instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05

Had a short to ground on <CAPACITOR>C7324</CAPACITOR>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTIN</SIGNAL> and not allowing unit to boot.

 Replaced the capacitor with Tantalum Polymer 16V 68uF 2917 20% ESR=50mOhms.

 System boots up to desktop and I'm thinking in good to go.

 Not so fast. No keyboard or trackpad.  I can plug in usb, however that's it.  Power button works, but SMC reset, or options on bootup seem not to function.

 I do have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> on pin 4 , but nothing on pin 30 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>

 How do I follow on the schematic where it's fed from. It shows the trace from keyboard connector , stops,  and a crap load of numbers ? What are these numbers next to it ?

 Page 38 shows a trace, and I don't understand where from ?

 Any help is much appreciated !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> comes from <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR> (page 66).
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR>/2 voltages?
Be sure no short on <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> rail (w/ and w/o trackpad connected).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Thanks for the quick replay !

Ok, hair confused.

 I see <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR> as a 6 leg chip on the board. However the schematics I see it portrayed as 4 legs, 1 on top and 3 under.

 So I posted what I see and tested from both views.

 <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR>  Actual Photo of board has Ohms as well as voltage (Board out of the unit)

 No short to ground on <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Oh and a follow up.

 Pin 30 on keyboard connector J4813 actually does get 3.34V from <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR>.  However after about 30 seconds I lose it . Board is out of unit (Breadboard).  Not sure if that's normal, but didn't want to leave that info out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Still waiting voltages for <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR>/2; means <TRANSISTOR>Q8000</TRANSISTOR> AND <TRANSISTOR>Q8002</TRANSISTOR>.
Especially when <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> goes off.

Use signal names from schematic, to locate in boardview.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Very sorry, was forced off the job and then the holidays..   Hoping you had a good one.

 For <TRANSISTOR>Q8002</TRANSISTOR>. this is what we have.

Pins:

1 : 0.0V / 1.0 Ohms
2 : 0.0V / 8.0 Ohms
3 : 3.31V / Open
4 : 0.0V / 0.4 Ohms
5 : 0.0V / 47.6 Ohms
6 : 3.2 V / Open

 Again sorry for the delay, and thanks for your time !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Very strange ohm values.
I hope you disconnect any power first.
Allow 10-15s and check on DIODE mode, not ohm scale.
BTW, no need to check ground pins (1 & 4)!

"5 : 0.0V"
Looks like board goes off; missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>.
What about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> at same time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Ok, think I had something wrong?

 Ohms by Pin  :

1 : 0.5
2  : 9.8 m
3 : 101.9 k
4 : 0.5
5 : 99.5 k
6 : 219.0 k

 I'll check the rest of the items now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Diode Mode :

2 :  Open
3 :  Open

5 :  Tone
6 :  Open


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  : 12.59 ?   Taken @ <TRANSISTOR>Q5400</TRANSISTOR> Pin 4 and <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>  Should be 3V right ?

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> : 3.34V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
We ALWAYS check diode mode with red probe connected to ground.
You cannot get OL in such case.

I already said do NOT check ground pins.
What do you think to get measuring GND-GND???

Was <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> missing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
Ok. I must need a few more days off...  

 Using Pos on ground in diode. Power Disconnected.  Third times a charm

2 : 0.434 V
3 : 0.434 V
5 : 0.626 V
6 : 0.617 V

 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>  3.34 V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message: Is the above what we were looking for ?  Newish to this, and yesterday was not a good example .....lol

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 No keyboard or trackpad after no boot due to capacitor short.
threads.message:
If you have <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, then pin 5/<TRANSISTOR>Q8002</TRANSISTOR> debe tener 3V al mismo tiempo.
This imply 0V at pin 3.
Remember, check mentioned signals and voltages, when the problem appears!
